title: 1302-F
statement: F. Keep talking and nobody explodes â€“ easytime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputThis is an unusual problem in an unusual contest, here is the announcement:http://codeforces.com/blog/entry/73543You have the safe lock which consists of 5 decimal digits. If you rotate some digit, it increases by one, except 9 which becomes 0.Initially, the lock contains number $$$x$$$. To unlock the safe you must do the following operations in order (and be careful, don't mix up if and else statements).If sum of digits on positions 1 and 4 is greater than 10, rotate digit on position 1 by 3 times, else rotate digit on position 4 by 8 times.If sum of digits on positions 3 and 2 is greater than 8, rotate digit on position 4 by 9 times, else rotate digit on position 5 by 8 times.If digit on position 3 is odd, rotate digit on position 3 by 3 times, else rotate digit on position 3 by 4 times.If digit on position 5 is greater than digit on position 2, rotate digit on position 4 by 1 times, else rotate digit on position 2 by 7 times.If digit on position 1 is odd, rotate digit on position 1 by 3 times, else rotate digit on position 3 by 5 times.If digit on position 4 is odd, rotate digit on position 4 by 7 times, else rotate digit on position 1 by 9 times.If digit on position 4 is greater than digit on position 1, rotate digit on position 4 by 9 times, else rotate digit on position 4 by 2 times.If digit on position 1 is greater than digit on position 3, rotate digit on position 2 by 1 times, else rotate digit on position 3 by 1 times.If digit on position 5 is greater than digit on position 3, rotate digit on position 4 by 5 times, else rotate digit on position 5 by 8 times.If sum of digits on positions 1 and 3 is greater than 8, rotate digit on position 4 by 5 times, else rotate digit on position 2 by 5 times.If digit on position 1 is greater than digit on position 4, rotate digit on position 4 by 3 times, else rotate digit on position 2 by 3 times.If sum of digits on positions 3 and 1 is greater than 9, rotate digit on position 2 by 9 times, else rotate digit on position 2 by 2 times.If sum of digits on positions 4 and 3 is greater than 10, rotate digit on position 4 by 7 times, else rotate digit on position 5 by 7 times.If digit on position 3 is greater than digit on position 2, rotate digit on position 3 by 2 times, else rotate digit on position 4 by 6 times.If digit on position 1 is greater than digit on position 3, rotate digit on position 1 by 9 times, else rotate digit on position 2 by 9 times.If digit on position 3 is odd, rotate digit on position 3 by 9 times, else rotate digit on position 1 by 5 times.If sum of digits on positions 3 and 5 is greater than 9, rotate digit on position 3 by 4 times, else rotate digit on position 3 by 9 times.If digit on position 3 is greater than digit on position 1, rotate digit on position 5 by 1 times, else rotate digit on position 5 by 7 times.If digit on position 1 is greater than digit on position 3, rotate digit on position 2 by 9 times, else rotate digit on position 4 by 6 times.If sum of digits on positions 2 and 3 is greater than 10, rotate digit on position 2 by 2 times, else rotate digit on position 3 by 6 times.InputInput contains single number $$$x$$$ consisting of exactly 5 digits, leading zeroes are allowed.OutputOutput the number after applying all operations.ExamplesInput00000Output61376Input12345Output07769

processed.result:
You are given a 5-digit number $x$.  You must perform a series of operations on the digits of $x$ in a specific order. Each operation involves rotating a digit by a certain number of times. The rotation rules are as follows:

* **Rule 1:** If the sum of the digits in positions 1 and 4 is greater than 10, rotate the digit in position 1 by 3 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 4 by 8 times.
* **Rule 2:** If the sum of the digits in positions 3 and 2 is greater than 8, rotate the digit in position 4 by 9 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 5 by 8 times.
* **Rule 3:** If the digit in position 3 is odd, rotate the digit in position 3 by 3 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 3 by 4 times.
* **Rule 4:** If the digit in position 5 is greater than the digit in position 2, rotate the digit in position 4 by 1 time. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 2 by 7 times.
* **Rule 5:** If the digit in position 1 is odd, rotate the digit in position 1 by 3 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 3 by 5 times.
* **Rule 6:** If the digit in position 4 is odd, rotate the digit in position 4 by 7 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 1 by 9 times.
* **Rule 7:** If the digit in position 4 is greater than the digit in position 1, rotate the digit in position 4 by 9 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 4 by 2 times.
* **Rule 8:** If the digit in position 1 is greater than the digit in position 3, rotate the digit in position 2 by 1 time. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 3 by 1 time.
* **Rule 9:** If the digit in position 5 is greater than the digit in position 3, rotate the digit in position 4 by 5 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 5 by 8 times.
* **Rule 10:** If the sum of the digits in positions 1 and 3 is greater than 8, rotate the digit in position 4 by 5 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 2 by 5 times.
* **Rule 11:** If the digit in position 1 is greater than the digit in position 4, rotate the digit in position 4 by 3 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 2 by 3 times.
* **Rule 12:** If the sum of the digits in positions 3 and 1 is greater than 9, rotate the digit in position 2 by 9 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 2 by 2 times.
* **Rule 13:** If the sum of the digits in positions 4 and 3 is greater than 10, rotate the digit in position 4 by 7 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 5 by 7 times.
* **Rule 14:** If the digit in position 3 is greater than the digit in position 2, rotate the digit in position 3 by 2 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 4 by 6 times.
* **Rule 15:** If the digit in position 1 is greater than the digit in position 3, rotate the digit in position 1 by 9 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 2 by 9 times.
* **Rule 16:** If the digit in position 3 is odd, rotate the digit in position 3 by 9 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 1 by 5 times.
* **Rule 17:** If the sum of the digits in positions 3 and 5 is greater than 9, rotate the digit in position 3 by 4 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 3 by 9 times.
* **Rule 18:** If the digit in position 3 is greater than the digit in position 1, rotate the digit in position 5 by 1 time. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 5 by 7 times.
* **Rule 19:** If the digit in position 1 is greater than the digit in position 3, rotate the digit in position 2 by 9 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 4 by 6 times.
* **Rule 20:** If the sum of the digits in positions 2 and 3 is greater than 10, rotate the digit in position 2 by 2 times. Otherwise, rotate the digit in position 3 by 6 times.



Output the resulting 5-digit number after applying all the rules.

You are given a 5-digit number.  Apply a series of rules to the digits of the number. Each rule involves comparing digits and rotating them a certain number of times. Output the resulting number after all rules are applied.
